tool_description: Horse racing API - UK & Ireland races. Racecards, results, stats, Odds comparator and more.
name: Horse Racing
title: Horse Racing

api_list.name: Race detail info
api_list.description:
**Get racecard detailed info** and **Odds comparator**
Horses, Jockeys, Trainers, Form, OR, Owner, Sire, Dam, Age, Weight and more information.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://horse-racing.p.rapidapi.com/race/207660"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "horse-racing.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://horse-racing.p.rapidapi.com/race/{id_race}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "horse-racing.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Query races
api_list.description: The best way to search races.

optional_parameters.name: order_by_date
optional_parameters.description: Results ordered by date race ascending or descending.

optional_parameters.name: id_horse
optional_parameters.description: Horse id. If you populate this field the query search races where this horse run.

optional_parameters.name: name
optional_parameters.description: Race name or a text on the race name. Like \"Novice\", \"Handicap chase\", \"Hurdle\", ....

api_list.name: Horse Stats
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://horse-racing.p.rapidapi.com/horse-stats/230380"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "horse-racing.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://horse-racing.p.rapidapi.com/horse-stats/{id_horse}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "horse-racing.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Query horses
api_list.description:
Search horses by name. 
Once you get "*id_horse*" from this query, you can get horses stats from "**Horse stats**" endpoint.

api_list.name: Racecards
Results
Jockeys win rate
api_list.description:
Get Jockeys stats in the last days.
Runs, Wins and Win Rate in %.

api_list.name: Trainers win rate
api_list.description:
Get Trainers stats in the last days.
Runs, Wins and Win Rate in %.
